in India when his semen was tested as a precautionary measure and it came up positive -- more than one month after he'd been declared free of any signs of Ebola. In fact, Ebola can be spread by all body fluids. In the case of semen, the CDC says Ebola has been found there

after a person has otherwise recovered. During that time it is not only present but still transmittable.

In the case of semen, the CDC says Ebola has been found thereafter a person has otherwise recovered.
In fact, Ebola can be spread by all body fluids.
During that time it is not only present but still transmittable.
